headline.main: Poisonous Effects of Soda Water from Copper Fountains and Lend Pipes.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the American Medical Monthly. Having, within a few days, had several friends relate their sudden illness after taking a single glass of soda water, and suspecting some poisonous impregnation to be the cause, I was induced to obtain several gallons of this favorite beverage from different parts of the City, and to submit them to a chemical examination.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE ENGLISH AT CONSTANTINOPLE.--NO small amount of sickness is likely to prevail among the inexperienced Europeans, unless they change their system of walking the streets at mid-day, and eating large meat dinners, accompanied by fiery liquids, as at home.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Recent Murder on the Packet-Ship Siddous--The Body Recovered--Inquest Before Coroner Gamble.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday morning, Coroner GAMBLE proceeded to the Dead-house, at the foot of Twenty-sixth-street, North River, and held an inquest on the body of the young German, whose name is unknown, and who, as was stated in the TIMES, was purposely thrown overboard from the packet-ship Siddons, by FREDERICK LEONARD, the second mate. LEONARD afterwards made his escape.

docs.lead_paragraph: "Drink not too many Sodas," has been our often repeated advice, " during this hot weather." They are apt to send men off with hands solemnly folded over the abdominal parietes, unpleasantly mindful of the fact that they have in possession that great receiving organ in which some philosophers have located the soul, and whick nine men out of ten do worship.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA HOSPITAL--Dr. J.C.HUTCHISON, attending physician at the Cholera Hospital, Brooklyn, makes the following report to the board of health, of the admissions, deaths and recoveries in said hospital, from the time it was open (June 26) to the present: Number admitted with cholera, 10; number admitted with after diseases, 2. Total, 12.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the New-Orleans Delta, 20th ult. The United States mail steamship Orizaba, Capt. FORBES, arrived yesterday morning from Vera Cruz, which place she left on the 22nd inst. The Orizaba brought $44,600 in specie. The following are the only important items of news we have been able to glean from the files:

headline.main: LONG-ISLAND.; THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN. CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN. BOY DROWNED WHILE BATHING. A RESPECTED CITIZEN GONE.s ACCIDENTS IN BROOKLYN.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN.--A man named MORRIS, a German, residing on Court-street, between Mill and Church, was taken with the cholera immediately after eating his dinner yesterday, and died within three hours. Another person in the same house was taken with the disease about the same time, and was not expected to recover last evening. Several other cases of cholera were reported yesterday.

headline.main: The Summer Watering Places--New-York to Montreal--The Saguenay Country.

docs.lead_paragraph: Having arrived, on my annual trip, at this favorite city, the commercial capital of the two Canadas, allows me to present to your readers a few of the many inducements to visit the noble St. Lawrence and the many interesting points on its banks, worthy the attention of the observing traveler.
